qas.question: On what date was Bertie Mee replaced by Arsenal?

context: <a1_0>Terry Neill<a1_0/> was recruited by the Arsenal board to replace <b6_0><b7_0>Bertie Mee<b7_0/><b6_0/> on <a0_0>9 July <b9_0>1976<b9_0/><a0_0/> and at the age of <b5_0>34<b5_0/> he became the youngest Arsenal manager to date. With <a2_0>new signings<a2_0/> like Malcolm Macdonald and Pat Jennings, and a crop of talent in the side such as Liam Brady and Frank Stapleton, the club enjoyed their best form since the 1971 double, reaching a <a3_0>trio<a3_0/> of FA Cup finals (<a4_0>1978, 1979 and 1980<a4_0/>), and losing the 1980 European Cup Winners' Cup Final on penalties. The club's only success during this time was a last-minute 3–2 victory over <b8_0>Manchester United<b8_0/> in the 1979 FA Cup Final, widely regarded as a classic.
